The Catholic Church needs to change some of its views. Many people are leaving the Church because it is not accepting of many things. The Church has strong views on issues like gay marriage, abortion and birth control. These views are old-fashioned and many people do not agree with them. 

If the Church changed its views, it would not lose its following. Many people are against the Church because it does not agree with them on certain subjects. The Church teaches that abortion is wrong, so people who support abortion will not be comfortable following the Church. The same is true for gay marriage.

The Church is also against women priests and married priests. But this may not have changed the problems the Church is facing. We do not know if married priests or female priests would have made a difference.

The Church says priests are married to God, but this does not mean they cannot have families. Many people have jobs and families. There is no reason why priests cannot have both.

I don't have strong feelings against gay marriage. In my opinion, people are born a certain way, and they should not be blamed for who they are. It's not something they choose. I think it's unfair to say people can get married if they are a man and a woman, but not if they are two people of the same sex.

It seems that being gay is not a choice. People are born to be straight or gay. I was born straight, and others are born gay. It's not something they can change.

I don't think the federal government should get involved in this issue. It's not a matter of law or morality. I don't think the government should tell people who they can or cannot marry.

I don't think people who are gay should be blamed for who they are. They should be free to live their lives as they want.

I don't think the federal government has the right to get involved in people's personal lives. It's not their place.

It's a difficult issue.

I think gay marriage should be legal. Here's why.

There's no good reason not to. Some people think gay couples threaten the heterosexual family. But this is different. There are many different aspects to it, making it hard to compare.

It's like two sides of the same coin. Heads is not the same as tails. But it's like the same thing. Gay couples have the same civil rights as others. For example, they should have the same property taxes and health care.

If you're in a gay couple, your partner can't visit you in the hospital unless they're considered family. This is unfair. If you're going to spend your life with someone, you should have the same rights as everyone else.

Many studies have shown that gay couples have the same success rates as straight couples. They have the same factors that contribute to a happy relationship.

The issue is, gay couples aren't asking for a church wedding. They want a marriage certificate from the government. If the government gives a civil union, why not a marriage?

Separate but equal is not fair. Gay couples are like straight couples in many ways. They have the same roles and responsibilities.

People worry about adoption and community issues. But children of gay couples are no different from those of straight couples. They need love and support, not fear and judgment.

In New York City, there are schools for children of gay parents because they face problems in public schools. They get bullied and parents protest to get them removed. This is unfair.

Gay couples can be good parents just like straight couples. Parenting skills are not different.

I think the federal government should make gay marriage legal in every state. The amendment against it is unfair. President Bush's views on gay marriage are based on his religion, but morality differs from person to person.

The government should not enforce one group's morality on the whole country. This is hypocritical, especially when some people are against "under God" in the pledge of allegiance.

Some people are against gay marriage because they think gay people are psychologically damaged. But this is not true, according to the American Psychological Association. People should listen to research, not popular opinion.

I worked in a hospital pharmacy over the summer. 

I think a drug is not bad just because it is against the law. Some illegal drugs are used in hospitals because they are helpful. 

For example, oxycodone and Vicodin are controlled substances. We use them often because they are good for patients. We should not deny the benefits of marijuana just because many people do not think it is good. 

Many people think marijuana is bad. But it is not as bad as alcohol. If you use too much of either, you can have problems. 

I think we should make marijuana legal slowly, not all at once. If we do it too fast, people might misuse it. But if we remove the idea that marijuana is bad, people might use it wisely. 

Some people have a bad idea about marijuana because it is against the law. But it is not as bad as heroin or cocaine. If we change the way people think about marijuana, they might use it responsibly. 

I do not think marijuana should be legal, but it should be used for medical reasons.

I think the church has changed with the times. It is not as strict as it used to be. I remember going to church every Sunday when I was young. I would get nice dresses and matching shoes. My friends and I would meet there on the weekends. Now, as I have grown older, the church has made some changes. They have a shorter service, just 30 minutes. People dress more casually, especially in the summer. They wear beach clothes and jeans.

I think this is the biggest change I have seen. The church I know does not discuss its politics, but I can see how it has changed. It is more casual now. Even at morning masses, people wear jeans and khakis.

I do not think allowing female priests or married priests would have stopped the problems with pedophilia. Some men are married and still become pedophiles. Their behavior is not because of their marriage status. It is their choice to become priests. Some other religions allow priests to get married, so if they want to practice their faith and be married, they should choose a different church.

I think being a pedophile is genetic. People are born with it, not because of how they are raised. You cannot hide it, and it usually comes out. The church cannot prevent it, but it should not try to cover it up if it knows about it.

I do not have any other thoughts about the Catholic Church.

I was okay with the idea of invading Iraq at first. But I think people were still very upset about the September 11th attacks and we went to war for the wrong reasons.

The Bush administration said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction. They said Saddam Hussein was connected to Osama Bin Laden and the September 11th attacks. But all of this has been proven false.

I am very angry about this. I think the Bush administration lied to the American people. Even Colin Powell, who presented evidence at the UN, now says he was not convinced by the evidence. I think this is wrong.

The Bush administration has no respect for the constitution and has tried to ignore it. They wanted to go to war before September 11th.

A former Secretary of the Treasury said the younger Bush wanted to go to war with Iraq because of his father's failed attempt. The younger Bush wanted to expand America's energy supply.

I think the war has gone on long enough. But if we leave now, there will be problems. The country may fall into civil war and more people will die.

The US and the UN are trying to work together to bring order to Iraq. They want to bring in countries from the surrounding area, like Syria and Saudi Arabia. But I am not sure this is a good idea. It may cause more problems in the long term.

Iraq's government is not working well. The Prime Minister does not have control and there are many groups fighting for power. The country is experiencing a lot of trouble.

I am not sure what the solution is. But I know that going to war was a bad idea.

I have thoughts about the War in Iraq. But I do not follow it closely. It is not a declared war. I think the U.S. went to war because Iraq was involved in the 9/11 attacks. 

Now, we are in Iraq to build a democracy. We also want oil from the country. However, our presence is causing problems. It is making many people unhappy. If we leave, Iraq will be angry with us. If we stay, it will take a long time to create a democracy. And if we leave, Iraq will be mad at us because we caused problems. 

I do not know much about this topic. It is hard for me to talk about it. I think the war should continue, but I do not think we should call it a war. We use guns to show our power and strength. However, I do not think it is fair to call it a war. A war must be declared by Congress, and this one was not.

I think we should stay in Iraq to help the people. But it is also using our resources. It is making President Bush look bad. I do not want him to be known as one of the worst presidents in U.S. history.

The Vietnam War was also not declared. It was called a meaningless war. I do not want President Bush to be called the same thing.

I have friends and family members in Iraq. I want the war to end because it is causing problems for them. However, I also do not want the war to end because it is making their lives better. It is hard to decide what to do.

I think the war in Iraq is a complicated issue. It is hard to know what to do. We are trying to change the culture in Iraq, but it is not working. It is making the problem worse. I think the war will continue for a long time. That is my thought on the War in Iraq.

I do not think it is right to make marijuana legal. The state should not decide this. It is up to the churches. The United States Constitution says there should be a separation of church and state. This is clear.

Making laws about marijuana would be against what the Constitution says. It would mean the government is deciding what the churches can and cannot say. But the Constitution says churches can have different ideas.

Many churches in the United States are against marijuana. But some, like those in Boston, are for it. I do not think the government should decide what churches can and cannot do.

Separation of church and state is a very important part of the Constitution. It helps us have religious freedom. The government planned to make an amendment about this, but I think that is not a good idea. It would be against what the Constitution says.

I also think it would be one of the only amendments that limits people, not the government. I do not think that is right.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. I do not see why the president is pushing for this law. It is against his own personal beliefs as a Catholic. He is showing that he prefers one religion over others.

It is up to the churches to decide this, not the president or government. There is no good reason for a law against marijuana, except for personal views. I do not see how it will affect the economy. It could even help it.

I think that is all I want to say.

The war in Iraq. I think the government was not honest with the American people about the reasons for the war. Before invading Iraq, I think there was an attempt to connect the invasion to the terrorist attacks of September 11th. But one did not have much to do with the other.

The government made it seem like that. They used the emotions of the American people in their anger about the terrorist attacks. The invasion of Iraq began in 2003. I personally am against war, especially a preemptive strike. I think the war in Iraq is like the Vietnam War in many ways. The government should have learned from their past mistakes.

Many American soldiers have died in the war. It's a big tragedy. They were removing the country's government, but the American government was not prepared for the problems that would happen after that. They were trying to put a democratic government in place, but it's not easy. It's like what happened in Vietnam, where they tried to remove the Communists and put in a democracy.

The US government should have known it would be a long and hard process. It was not a clear victory like they thought it would be. They were fighting against the people of Iraq, not an army. They were fighting against the citizens of the country. I think the government was not prepared for all the problems that would happen.

If you go to war, you need to plan for all the possible outcomes. I think the government was not prepared for what would happen after they removed the Iraqi government. We are still in Iraq today, and many American troops are still dying. They are still trying to train the Iraqi troops and police to be able to control their own country. It's a long process.

I think the US government tried to deceive the American people into thinking it would be a short and successful war. They made it seem like it would be easy to put in a democratic government. But it's not easy. Democracy is a long struggle. We should have learned from our own country's history.

The war in Iraq is a difficult decision to make. It's hard to decide what to do now that we've been there for so long. We took away their government and their way of life. How can we leave them now? But there's also the problem of the many American casualties. It's too much to risk for a free democratic Iraq.

If we're invading Iraq to make it a democratic nation, why aren't we doing the same thing in other countries? I think the big reason is the oil issue. It's about the oil and controlling resources. Before going to war, they said Iraq had weapons of mass destruction, but none were ever found. We are not attacking countries like North Korea that we know have weapons of mass destruction.

I just hope the war ends soon and there is peace in Iraq. But it's not likely.

I am in favor of gay marriage. I have always been. I think it is a personal preference. It has been proven that it could be biological, not just a matter of how people are raised. This means that people should not be punished because of something they cannot control.

I think it is unfair and inhumane to deny people rights because of their sexual orientation. I have always supported gay marriage.

I do not think the government should be involved in this issue. It is a personal matter, not a state or national issue. In my neighborhood, there are several openly gay couples who are not married because they are not allowed to be. They live like any other family. They walk their dogs, just like everyone else.

I think it is ridiculous for President Bush to try to decide what marriage means. He is trying to be God.

I have read that some people are born with a chemical in their brain that makes them gay. It is not something they choose. It is not because of how they were raised. For example, someone who has many sisters and no brothers may be gay. This is a biological reason, not a social one.

Marriage is a private matter. If a man and a woman want to get married, they can do it in secret. But if two men or two women want to get married, it is a big public issue. I think marriage should be a private, personal thing, not something that affects the whole country.

When you put something on the internet, it is public and everyone can see it. You cannot control who sees it. I know this from my experience as a resident advisor. If you say something online, it can affect how people think of you. If you talk about violence or shootings, people will react. The internet is public, and many people will see what you say. If you are friends with someone on social media, you will see their messages. 

The school cannot ignore things people say online. If someone hears something and reports it, the school must act. They cannot wait, or they might miss a chance to prevent a problem. 

But it is hard to know what to believe. Some people just joke around online. It could be an experiment gone wrong, like a sociology class project. Or it could be serious. 

In this case, someone overheard a student saying something. They reported it, and the school found out who said it. They looked at the student's online profiles and saw things that could be serious. The student had posted things that might be jokes, but in this situation, people thought they were serious. 

When you put something online, you give up your privacy. If you don't want people to see it, don't put it online. If you don't want people to think something of you, don't post it. You cannot control what people think. School officials should not friend their students on social media. They should not look at their private messages and profiles. But if someone brings something to their attention, they must take it seriously. If it is a danger, they must act.

I don't think teachers should make fake social media accounts to friend their students. That is not right. As a resident advisor, I don't want to know if my residents are doing things they shouldn't be doing. I don't want to see their pictures on social media. I don't want to have to deal with it.

I think the war has lasted too long. 
I believe the original purpose was good: to bring democracy to another country. 
But I think we have lost sight of that goal. 
We are now fighting just to show we are powerful. 
I also think the motives may have been questionable from the start. 
George Bush's father had problems with Saddam Hussein. 
If we were fighting to give democracy to a country, that would be fine. 
But if there were personal reasons, it was not right. 
I think we made our point in the first few months. 
But the war has lasted for many years. 
That's too long.

If our goal was to give democracy to a country ruled by a bad leader, that's a good reason for war. 
But I don't think that's why we are fighting now. 
Our reasons have changed. 
We're fighting just to fight. 
We don't want to leave without winning. 

I think the war has lasted too long. 
The country's leaders will have to take care of themselves soon. 
That time has come. 
We are spending too much money on this war. 
We should use that money to help our own country. 
We have problems with poverty and roads and schools that need fixing. 
We should spend our money on those things, not on a war that is not important to us. 

We are spending billions of dollars on the war. 
War should not be in our budget for a long time. 
We have many problems to solve at home. 
We should use our money to help our own people. 
Right now, our money is being used to kill our own citizens in a war that is not important to us.

I have a question about something that happened recently.

Someone found out about it because they looked it up on the internet. They used a site called Myspace. When you join Myspace, you have to let someone be your friend to see your profile. But when you are friends, you are giving them permission to see your information.

When you put things on the internet, it is like sending a message to everyone. Many people can see what you say. So when someone saw this information, it helped stop a bad situation.

But it is hard to have one person check all of the profiles to prevent problems. It would be unfair to look at some students and not others. Also, it would be too much work for one person to look at all of the profiles.

I have a Facebook account. It bothers me that there are people who can see things about me without my permission. I saw a show once about someone who found a girl's screen name and talked to her in just a few minutes. It is hard to know who is really your friend on the internet.

I try to limit what I put on Facebook, but it is hard. The point of having Facebook is to talk to friends. But you never know who can see what you say. My roommate told me that her school once banned students from having Myspace accounts. I don't know if that is right. Schools should not have the power to tell students what they can and cannot have on the internet.

I want to talk about the Iraq War. I feel bad talking about it because many people already disagree with the war. I was also against it from the beginning. But it's not that important now. Most people in the world think the war was a bad idea. Seventy-five to eighty percent of people in the world think so, including seventy percent of US troops in Iraq.

The situation in Iraq was very bad before the US went in. Now, pulling out is also a problem. There is no easy answer for this situation. It's like a big cultural difference between the US and Middle Eastern countries. Americans think they can bring democracy to Iraq, but the Iraqis might not want it.

Saddam Hussein was a bad leader. However, we had to think carefully before invading his country. The war has been a disaster. I do not see a reason for the US to stay in Iraq. If the US wants to leave gradually, I wouldn't mind. But I don't see a reason why we can't leave now.

Most Iraqis want the US to leave within a year. They know their country better than the US. If we leave and things get bad, we can say we followed their wishes. If we stay and things get bad, we will be blamed.

I do not think we can be the good guys in the Middle East. But leaving would be better than staying where we are now.

I think there is still gender discrimination in the United States.  This is not just about women, but about the job field as well.  Most people find it hard to work under a woman because society has been raised for a long time that men are in charge.

Women often see a job they can do well, but may not be chosen for it because it's not seen that women are in high places in business.  The same thing happens to men in certain industries like fashion or being a stay-at-home parent.  Society looks down on men who stay home with their children, even if it's their dream. 

In the fashion industry, people do not take straight men seriously.  They think if you're a man in fashion, you probably have a different lifestyle, so how can you really know about fashion for women?  Depending on the job field, there is definitely gender discrimination in society in the U.S.

Changing this is hard because society has a set mindset.  But we are making progress.  Women are becoming CEOs and getting more accepted in business.  More men are staying home to take care of their children, and people are starting to accept that.  We just need to promote the good qualities of people who are stereotyped against, without being too pushy.  If we do this too fast, people will resist.  We have come a long way, and change takes time.

People can also be discriminated against based on where they are from or their grammar.  If someone from a farm with poor grammar but good intelligence tries to become a CEO, other men may look down on them because they don't think they can express themselves well.

I think what happened in this place is that they did not make it legal. 
They made it less serious. 
They changed it from a crime to something like a traffic ticket. 
You can get in trouble, but it is not as bad as before. 
If you get caught, you will get a ticket. 
This is good because it will not affect your future as much. 
But at the same time, there are some problems. 
It costs a lot to arrest and keep people in jail. 
And it costs money to take them to court and for them to have a lawyer. 
So, if a city is in financial trouble, they might not want to do this. 
But in some places, like Denver, people are more open-minded. 
They think it is okay. 
And it is true that they have more money to spend on important things. 
They can spend it on education, help for old people, and food for people who do not have enough.

I think it is a good idea. 
But there are some problems. 
If marijuana is legal, people might smoke it everywhere. 
They might drive while smoking, which is not safe. 
And it is still not okay in many places to smoke marijuana. 
Some people do not want it to be legal. 
They think it will be a problem.

I do not know what to think. 
But I think marijuana can be bad for some people. 
It can affect their judgment and their lifestyle. 
But it is not the same for everyone. 
Some people can handle it, but others cannot. 
So, it is hard to say for sure.

I agree. Here's why. 

Many things the Catholic Church does are traditional. They do the same things for a long time. It's good to be rooted in tradition. But it's also important to change with times.

Some Catholics go to church every week. They are very strict about how things are done. Sometimes I think the Catholic Church looks down on people who do not follow the rules exactly. They do not accept people who are not perfect Catholics. They also do not accept people of other religions.

For example, my parents are not the same religion. My dad was Episcopalian. The Catholic Church would not marry them. This is not very tolerant of other religions.

We always learned to love others in Catholic school. This is a Catholic teaching. But it's hypocritical to say to love others and not accept them.

So I think some Catholic teachings tell you to do things, but then the practice goes against it. This is because it's outdated. But they continue to do it anyway.

I don't think allowing priests to marry would stop them from molesting children. If someone is going to do something bad, they will do it anyway. It's different to be with a child than with a spouse.

So I don't think allowing priests to be married would prevent these bad things from happening.

I am not sure about this issue. I have not made a decision yet. I do not know if one side is right or wrong. But I think this is a difficult problem. It is hard to decide without hurting someone's feelings.

The issue is about the separation of church and state. It is also about how to define marriage. This is a very hard thing to do. It involves many people and many different ideas.

I do not think the government should decide what kind of marriage is good or bad. I think it should just be about two people getting together and living together. They should not have to worry about what the government thinks about their marriage.

People who are gay should be allowed to have the same rights as other couples. They should be able to get married and have the same tax breaks and other benefits. It is not fair to treat them differently.

If all the states can agree on this, then the government should make it a federal law. But a constitutional amendment to stop gay marriage is not a good idea. It is not important enough to change the constitution.

We should not change the constitution just to make one group of people unhappy. We should let people live their lives as they want. 

I do not support a ban on gay marriage.

I was raised in a Christian home. This makes homosexuality a confusing issue for me. I have many gay friends. I do not agree with this lifestyle. However, I think it should be allowed. I do not think it should be a national issue. I believe each state should decide for itself, not the president.

I think a democratic state will be in favor of gay marriage. If you live in a democratic state, you should respect the decision. You chose to live there. I think homosexuals should be treated the same as heterosexuals. Each state should decide if they want to allow gay marriage.

I already answered that. I do not think President Bush should decide for the whole country. He does not live in every state. He should not decide how each state should be run. Some things should be left to each individual state. President Bush will leave office in a few years. If a new president wants to lift the ban on gay marriage, it will be changed. Each state should decide for itself because they will have to live with the decision, not the president.

I do not agree with the school officials' actions. They went on the internet to see if students were doing anything wrong. Myspace is a public place. If students post things there, they should be prepared for others to see them. The school officials could see the information even if it was not under the school's name.

They can still find it at home. And if it helps prevent a school shooting, I think that is a good reason to look. Students are a school's responsibility. If school officials go on the internet to see if students are doing something wrong, they are doing their job. I do not think this is an invasion of privacy.

But I do think it is an invasion of privacy if they go on the internet just to catch students doing something wrong. They are trying to catch students in trouble. I do not think this is right. If they are looking for a good reason to make the school safer, I do not think that is an invasion.

It is easy to express yourself when you write. I do not think it is right for students to post things on the internet that they do not want others to see. If you post something on the internet, it will always be there. If you do something wrong, you will get in trouble.

I do not think that school officials should go on the internet just to catch students. But if they have a good reason to make the school safer, I do not think that is an invasion of privacy. Other officials, like the police, can also go on the internet if they have a good reason.

When parents drop off their children at school, they think the school is a safe place. The school officials were trying to make the school safer. They were practicing things like lock downs in case of a school shooting. This is like the Columbine incident. I think the school officials were doing their job.

I was for the war, but now I am against it. 
I was personally affected by nine eleven. 
I wanted to fight back and hurt those who caused it. 
But, I think we went to war without a good plan. 
We did not think about what could happen later. 
We just acted on our feelings, not on a plan. 
Now, I think the war did not help. 
The people over there are fighting each other. 
They cannot fight against us if they fight each other. 
I do not care about what happens to them anymore. 
Sometimes, I think they are not human. 
They are very different from us. They fight all the time and do not try to make their country better. 
They just want us to leave. 
I think we should leave them alone. 
We went to war without knowing what to expect. 
War is different for them than it is for us. 
They are very aggressive and do not care about their country. 
I think we should have thought more before going to war. 
We were not thinking clearly. 
We wanted revenge. 
President Bush wanted to go to war because many people wanted it. 
He declared war on Iraq without a good plan. 
I think we had to go to war, but we could have done it better. 
We did not have a clear plan to create order. 
We were not united. 
We did not know why we were fighting. 
I think a clear plan would have helped us. 
We went to war with anger and emotion. 
That caused problems in Iraq. 
I do not think we can change the people in Iraq. 
They will always be the same. 
I do not think we should stay in Iraq. 
We have made some progress, but not enough. 
Iraq will collapse when we leave. 
Staying in Iraq is hurting us. 
We should leave and let them handle their own problems.
